{{morefootnotes|date=April 2010}} {{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |sex=women |Year=2009â10 |Prev year=2008â09 |Next year=2010â11 |Team=Stanford Cardinal |Image= Stanford plain block "S" logo.svg |ImageSize=100 px |Conference= Pacific-10 Conference |ShortConference= Pac-10 |CoachRank=2 |APRank=2 |Record=36â2 |ConfRecord=18â0 |HeadCoach=[[Tara VanDerveer]] |HCYear=25th |AsstCoach1=[[Amy Tucker (coach)|Amy Tucker]]

|AST1Year=25th |AsstCoach2=[[Bobbie Kelsey]]

Pacific-10 Tournament Champion |BowlTourney=[[2010 NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA]] |BowlTourneyResult=Runner-up }} {{2009â10 Pacific-10 Conference women's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 Stanford Cardinal women's basketball team''' represented [[Stanford University]] in the [[2009â10 NCAA Division I women's basketball season]]. The Cardinal, coached by [[Tara VanDerveer]]. and a member of the [[Pacific-10 Conference]], won the conference's regular-season and tournament titles, and was the runner-up at the [[2010 NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA championship]].Associated Press,[http://www.ncaa.org/wps/portal/ncaahome?WCM_GLOBAL_CONTEXT=/wps/wcm/connect/ncaa/ncaa/ncaa+news/ncaa+news+online/2010/division+i/connecticut+rallies+to+keep+streak+alive_04_07_10_ncaa_news&utm_source=delivra&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=NCAA%20News%20Direct Connecticut rallies to keep streak alive], ''NCAA News'', April 7, 2010 ==Offseason== * May 17: All five Stanford women's basketball players invited to the [[USA Basketball]] trials camps were named finalists for their respective teams. Freshmen Sarah Boothe and [[Nneka Ogwumike|Nnemkadi Ogwumike]] were among the 14 finalists named for the USA Women's U19 World Championship Team. Junior [[Jayne Appel]] and sophomores Kayla Pedersen and Jeanette Pohlen were among the 14 finalists named for the 2009 USA Women's World University Games Team. :Appel, Pedersen and Pohlen will return to Colorado Springs, Colo. on June 18 for training camp. The camp will last until the team's departure on June 25 for the [[2009 Summer Universiade|2009 World University Games]]. The 12-woman roster will be named prior to the team's departure for the Games, which are set to take place from July 1â11 in [[Belgrade]], [[Serbia]]. :Boothe and Ogwumike will return to Colorado Springs for training camp on July 9, where the final 12-woman roster for the U19 World Championship will be determined. The 2009 FIBA U19 World Championship is set to take place from July 23âAugust 2 in [[Bangkok, Thailand]].http://www.gostanford.com/sports/w-baskbl/spec-rel/051709aaa.html *July 30: The Women's Basketball Coaches Association ([[Women's Basketball Coaches Association|WBCA]]), on behalf of the Wade Coalition, announced the 2009â2010 preseason "Wade Watch" list for The [[Wade Trophy|State Farm Wade Trophy Division I Player of the Year]]. Three players from the Cardinal, Jayne Appel, Kayla Pederson and Jeannette Pohlen, have been named to the 2009â10 preseason "Wade Watch" list,http://www.bigeast.org/ViewArticle.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=19400&ATCLID=204766999 which is made up of top NCAA Division I student-athletes who best embody the spirit of [[Margaret Wade (basketball coach)|Lily Margaret Wade]]. This is based on the following criteria: game and season statistics, leadership, character, effect on their team and overall playing ability. *August 21: The 2009â10 preseason candidates list for the Womenâs [[Wooden Award]] was released, naming 31 student athletes. Jayne Appel and Jeanette Pohlen from Stanford were two of the candidates.http://www.ncaa.com/sports/w-baskbl/spec-rel/082109aaa.html ==Regular season== * Jayne Appel became the leading rebounder in Pac-10 history on 27 February 2010, surpassing [[Lisa Leslie]]'s record of 1,214 career rebounds.{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/breaking-news/ci_14485196|title=Jayne Appel breaks Pac-10 career rebounding record as Stanford routs Arizona|date=27 February 2010|work=MercuryNews.com|accessdate=5 March 2010}} ===Schedule=== {{CBB Schedule Start|tv=no|gamehighs=no|attend=no}} |-
